com.pks.names.extension
Class CheckBankNameCompatibility

java.lang.Object
  com.pks.names.extension.CheckNameCompatibility
      com.pks.names.extension.CheckBankNameCompatibility

public class CheckBankNameCompatibility
extends CheckNameCompatibility

A class function intended to check if two provided names appear to be generally acceptable as matching, this is an extension of CheckNameCompatibility specifically designed for bank account name matching.

This class is intended to check names in the context that a person has provided their name and the name of a bank account that is supposed to belong to them. because they may be used in differing contexts, they may vary slightly. E.g. a person uses a preferred name or the name as a matter of habit on other documents, or misses the middle name or uses an initial. Extending this to businesses then the name may be merged with a trading name e.g. J Smith trading as Smiths Crisps.

Originally designed as an OPA extension this class may be invoked as follows: Firstly note that this uses a default constructor that takes no parameters and that it is designed as thread-safe. YOu may therefore invoke by:

  • Create a new instance each time it is needed and call the "evaluate" method to compare the names
  • Have a container create a singleton new instance and cache it, call the "evaluate" method on this stored instance to compare the names
The OPA runtime uses this second method and it is most efficient if deployed in a application server or web service environment

Method Detail

evaluate

public java.lang.Object evaluate(java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String bankAccountName,
                                 java.lang.String entityDescription,
                                 java.lang.String optionalSuffixToRemove)
Compare a persons/or organisations name with the name of a bank account that is asserted to be their bank account. This utilises a Name checking algorithm that checks for perfect matches, typos and similar. It then considers if the entity is a person or thing and looks at use of initials and shortened names for people, for organisations it looks at common industry abbreviations and applies stemming rules

Parameters:
name - the name of the party to be compared.
bankAccountName - the name of the bank account belonging to the party
entityDescription - the Description of the type of entity - "INDIVIDUAL" or "PARTNER" have particular rules, other types may be entered but are all treated as "inanimate things"
optionalSuffixToRemove - sometimes names may have suffixes, for example the bank may suffix an individual account with the word "BUSINESS" or "BUSINESS ACCOUNT", this option allows it to be ignored
Returns:
true if the names reasonably match, false if not, null if there is an parameter error
